container.heading: Temporary License to Practice Dental Hygiene

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: These regulations establish qualifications and requirements for applicants for a temporary license to practice dental hygiene in Maryland.

section.heading: Eligibility.
section.text: An individual is eligible for a temporary license to practice dental hygiene if the individual:

para.text: Is a graduate of a school for dental hygienists that requires at least 2 years of education in an institution of higher learning that is accredited by the American Dental Association Commission on Dental Accreditation and is approved by the Board;
Is currently licensed to practice dental hygiene in any other state or any province of Canada; and
Has practiced dental hygiene at least 800 hours per year for 2 years and has practiced dental hygiene during the past 2 years.

section.heading: Application Procedures.
section.text: An applicant shall submit to the Board:

para.text: An application on the form that the Board requires for a temporary license;
Proof of current licensure in another state or province of Canada;
A statement from previous employers verifying the required practice experience;
An application fee as specified in COMAR 10.44.20.

section.heading: Jurisprudence Examination.
section.text: Before a temporary license to practice dental hygiene is issued, the applicant shall pass a written examination administered by the Board, on the Maryland Dentistry Act, Health Occupations Article, Title 4, Annotated Code of Maryland, and regulations adopted under that Act.

para.text: A temporary license expires on the date when licenses are issued to those who pass the first examination for a general license to practice dental hygiene given over 30 days after the effective date of the temporary license.

Notification that the temporary licensee has failed the first examination for a general license to practice dental hygiene given over 30 days after the effective date of the temporary license shall serve as notice of the expiration of that temporary license.
A temporary license to practice dental hygiene is not renewable.

annotations.annotation: Health Occupations Article, §4-312, Annotated Code of Maryland
Regulation .02A amended effective July 27, 1998 (25:15 Md. R. 1191)
Regulation .03D amended effective July 27, 1998 (25:15 Md. R. 1191)
